intro: Siphocampylus psilophyllus var. longisepalus, commonly known as the long-sepaled siphocampylus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its sepals are notably elongated, giving it the specific epithet "longisepalus." Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
